ETYMOLOGY: From Middle English 'dryer', from 'dry' (adjective) + '-er' (suffix denoting an agent or instrument).
SINCE: Late 14th century (general sense); early 20th century (for appliances).

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Noun: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A machine or device designed to remove moisture from clothes, hair, or other objects, typically using heat or air circulation.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 一种旨在去除衣物、头发或其他物体水分的机器或设备，通常通过加热或空气循环实现。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: My clothes dryer broke down, so I had to take my laundry to the laundromat.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 我的干衣机坏了，所以我不得不把衣服拿到自助洗衣店去洗。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Noun: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A chemical substance, often a metallic compound, added to paint, varnish, or ink to accelerate its drying or hardening process.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 一种化学物质，通常是金属化合物，添加到油漆、清漆或墨水中以加速其干燥或硬化过程。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The artist added a special dryer to the oil paint to ensure it would be touch-dry by morning.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 艺术家在油画颜料中加入了一种特殊的干燥剂，以确保它能在早上达到表干。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Noun: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A person whose occupation or task involves drying things.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 从事干燥工作或职责的人。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The old factory employed several dryers to prepare the herbs for packaging.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 这家老工厂雇佣了几名干燥工来准备包装草药。

REGISTER: Commonly used in everyday conversation and technical contexts, primarily referring to household appliances.
